summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from July 28, 2019, regarding the status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It details his removal from psychological observation and suicide watch, his complaints about cell conditions (a malfunctioning toilet), his physical symptoms (numbness in his arm and neck), and his schedule in the Attorney Conference room. The exchanges involve facility staff coordinating his movement and addressing his concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of the emails. He is being taken off psychological observation and suicide watch, and he complains about physical symptoms (numb arm/neck) and a malfunctioning toilet in his cell.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch/Psych Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein is officially taken off of psychological observation and suicide watch status.

events.title: Epstein Reports Receiving Only One Meal
events.description: Epstein complained that on the previous day, he only received one meal (a sandwich at about 4:15 PM) despite being in the Attorney Conference room from 8 AM to 8 PM.

events.title: Toilet Malfunction in Epstein's Cell
events.description: The toilet in Epstein's cell reportedly flushed/running for 45 minutes, which he found aversive and disorienting, leading him to urinate in a cup to avoid it.

keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was taken off psychological observation and suicide watch.
Epstein complained of physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm, an inability to make a fist, and numbness on his neck.
Epstein reported a malfunctioning toilet in his cell that ran for 45 minutes the previous night, which he found so distressing he began urinating in a cup.
Epstein complained about his meal schedule, stating he was in the Attorney Conference room from 8 AM to 8 PM and had only received one meal the previous day.
